<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AVIATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/boeing-temporarily-shut-737-max-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Boeing Takes Its Most Drastic Step Yet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Boeing 737 Max planes parked" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM5ODI4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Stephen Brashear/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing said it will temporarily suspend production of the 737 Max aircraft in January in what the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/16/business/boeing-737-max.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT calls</a> “one of the most consequential decisions in the manufacturer’s more than 100-year history.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The recent history: </strong>The 737 Max was involved in two fatal crashes that killed 346 people over the span of five months. The plane hasn’t seen the skies since March as regulators wait for a fix to an automated software system involved in both tragedies.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But production didn’t stop</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Boeing was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-to-suspend-737-max-production-in-january-11576532032?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still making</a> around 40 737 Max planes each month in anticipation of getting the green light from authorities. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Now, it’s got about </span><span><a href="https://www.ft.com/content/0f4cbec6-2045-11ea-b8a1-584213ee7b2b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">400 Max planes</a></span><span> racking up parking tickets at a Boeing facility near Seattle. That’s more than the 383 Max planes flying at the time the FAA grounded the model.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It didn’t really have a choice but to keep the 737 Max factory open. As of Nov. 30, Boeing had an order backlog of 4,545 Max models. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Ripple effects </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company’s best selling plane is now the face of an industry-wide crisis. Because Boeing relies on a constellation of over 600 aerospace suppliers to feed it parts, if Boeing has to shut down its own assembly line, its suppliers likely have to do the same. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And when Boeing catches a cold, airlines get sick. Southwest and United won’t be flying the Max commercially until March at the earliest—American is waiting until early April. “We're not happy about our situation,” Southwest CEO Gary Kelly <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/airline-chiefs-frustrated-as-boeing-737-max-grounding-cost-nears-1-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CNBC</a> in October.<strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The good news: </strong></span><span>In its </span><span><a href="https://boeing.mediaroom.com/2019-12-16-Boeing-Statement-Regarding-737-MAX-Production?sf226241718=1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">statement</a></span><span> Boeing said it’s not expecting layoffs or furloughs right now.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>As the nation's top manufacturing exporter <span>and one of its top private employers</span>, Boeing’s factories are among the most closely watched in the world. Stopping production will likely hit U.S. GDP growth in Q1.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/intel-ups-ai-game-2-billion-acquisition-habana-labs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Teaching a 51-Year-Old Dog New Chips
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A computer powered by Intel " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM4Njg3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If 30 is the new 20, Intel is making the case that 51 is the new founding year. In its latest effort to “turbo-charge” its artificial intelligence (AI) offerings, Intel <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/12/16/intel-buys-ai-chipmaker-habana-for-2-billion/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">paid</a> $2 billion to acquire Israeli chip startup Habana Labs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The purpose: </strong>Habana’s chips will <a href="https://www.engadget.com/2019/12/16/intel-ai-acquires-habana-labs/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soup up</a> Intel's data centers to help algorithms translate numbers into trends.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But this is bigger than data storage</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Isn’t it always? Intel previously said it’s penciling in over <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90425160/inside-intels-billion-dollar-transformation-in-the-age-of-ai?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$3.5 billion</a> in AI-related revenue this year, up 20% annually.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And it’s on the hunt for growth opportunities.</strong> It can <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/intel-acquires-habana-labs-for-about-2-billion-11576508408?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">only boost market share</a> in its core business—powering personal computers and tablets—so much. So it’s looking to grab a little sunlight in the booming field of artificial intelligence.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2017, Intel paid $15.3 billion for vehicle camera maker Mobileye, which uses AI to train self-driving cars.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In 2016, it bought AI startup Nervana Systems for about $400 million.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The market for chips that power AI is expected to grow to $25 billion by 2024, per Intel. And almost half that revenue will likely come from selling chips used in giant data centers.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Want more AI news?</strong> Subscribe to our newsletter Emerging Tech Brew <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=emtech&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/homebuilder-confidence-spikes-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Builders Get Mentally Swole
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Housing construction " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM4ODQ3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The only group of people more self-assured than Kumail Nanjiani are U.S. homebuilders, whose confidence shot up to a 20-year high for the month yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How do you measure “homebuilder confidence?” </strong>Using the National Association of Home Builders/Wells Fargo Housing Market Index. It <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/16/homebuilder-confidence-jumps-to-highest-level-in-20-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rose five points</a> in December to 76, the highest level since June 1999. Any reading higher than 50 reflects optimism. <strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Why life is good: </strong></span><span>unemployment at a </span><span><a href="https://www.nahb.org/news-and-publications/press-releases/2019/12/builder-confidence-ends-year-strong.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">50-year low</a></span><span>, higher wages, and lower mortgage rates.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">What could be better:</strong></span><span> if there were more available workers and land. A lack of inventory is driving home prices higher. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Overall, the index <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/u-s-homebuilder-sentiment-soars-to-20-year-high-on-sales-gains?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gained</a> 20 points this year, its biggest increase since 2012. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>This housing data was just one of several positive readings for the economy yesterday. New York manufacturers said business conditions are (mostly) <a href="https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/201912163747/empire-state-manufacturing-surveys-measure-of-business-conditions-rises?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">solid</a>, while <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/u-s-economy-ends-year-on-modest-note-ihs-markit-gauges-show?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">surveys</a> of factories and the services sector didn’t raise any alarms.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAX
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/corporations-get-big-tax-cut-president-trump?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What, Me Pay Taxes?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two things in life are certain: death and holiday flight delays. If you thought we were going to say taxes...do we have some stats for you.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the left-leaning <a href="https://itep.org/corporate-tax-avoidance-in-the-first-year-of-the-trump-tax-law/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Institute on Taxation and Economy Policy</a> (ITEP), 379 of America’s biggest companies paid an average federal tax rate of about 11% last year, roughly half the official 21% rate established by President Trump’s 2017 tax cut.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>91 corporations in the Fortune 500 paid </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/16/these-91-fortune-500-companies-didnt-pay-federal-taxes-in-2018.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>no</em> federal taxes</a></span><span> last year despite earning a combined $101 billion. Their average federal tax rate was -5.9%, so...a tax refund.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How that happens: </strong>Investing in good accountants. And utilizing deductions, tax breaks, and other loopholes to lower their effective rates. Last year’s 11% rate is the <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/12/16/corporations-paid-percent-tax-rate-last-year-steep-drop-under-president-trumps-law/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lowest</a> since ITEP started tracking in 1984.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Had the 379 profitable members of the Fortune 500 paid a 21% rate on their profits, the government would have netted an additional $73.9 billion in revenue. Right now, D.C. is staring down a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/25/federal-deficit-increases-26percent-to-984-billion-for-fiscal-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$984 billion</a> federal deficit.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F16%2Fcorporations-get-big-tax-cut-president-trump" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">

Plus, Fundrise portfolios are <em>internally</em> diverse, too:</p>

</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Deepening your diversification strategies can boost your long-term investment performance.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/warriors-named-franchise-decade-sports-business-journal?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And the Award for “Franchise of the Decade” Goes to…
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Klay Thompson of Golden State Warriors" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Y3UJBlQ8URhe0/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Klay Thompson of Golden State Warriors" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/Y3UJBlQ8URhe0/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sports Business Journal has <a href="https://www.sportsbusinessdaily.com/Journal/Issues/2019/12/16/Decade-Awards/Franchise.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">named</a> the NBA’s Golden State Warriors “Franchise of the Decade.” We have to think it’s the first 5–23 team to win the award. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>When Kleiner Perkins partner Joe Lacob and a group of investors dropped a shocking <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2016/04/03/magazine/what-happened-when-venture-capitalists-took-over-the-golden-state-warriors.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$450 million</a> to buy the Warriors in 2010, it was the most anyone had spent for an NBA team. But following a hugely successful decade in which the team won three titles and changed the game of basketball, it’s looking like one of the savviest Silicon Valley investments in recent history.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Warriors...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.nba.com/warriors/news/sbj-team-of-decade-20191216?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Led the league</a></span><span> in revenue for each of the last three years. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Increased revenue by over 1,000% this decade.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Opened the Chase Center in September 2019, which the team says is the only privately financed sports venue built on private property in the modern sports era.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, according to <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbespr/2019/02/06/forbes-releases-21st-annual-nba-team-valuations/#13820a011a70?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Forbes</a>, the Warriors are worth $3.5 billion.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F16%2Fwarriors-named-franchise-decade-sports-business-journal" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/suck-data-sell-back-kara-swisher-techs-future?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Suck Our Data and Sell It Back: Kara Swisher on Tech’s Future
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="Kara Swisher on Business Casual " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM1MTg1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What was the first thing you looked at when you woke up this morning? After Morning Brew, it was probably a product from Facebook, Twitter, Google, or Apple. But who actually makes the rules for the exclusive Big Tech club running our lives?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">This week on Morning Brew’s weekly podcast, </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Business Casual</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">, we figure it out. </strong>Kara Swisher, who cofounded Recode and has been covering tech for as long as there’s been tech to cover, sat down for a conversation on tech ethics, futurism, and more.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The highlights:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What company is a “rapacious data thief”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Elon Musk and the future of the mad scientist CEO</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Why Uber’s top leadership might be misunderstood</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As Silicon Valley’s resident kingmaker, Swisher ranks among <em>Business Casual</em>’s most outspoken guests. Which makes this episode ridiculously entertaining. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen to the episode now:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Swisher_Apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Swisher_Spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/Swisher_All?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WHAT ELSE IS BREWING
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/netflix-breaks-down-results-by-region-showing-strong-asia-pacific-europe-growth-1203440307/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Netflix</a></span><span> revealed lots of juicy details about its international business. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-tyson-foods-china-poultry/tyson-foods-cleared-to-ship-poultry-to-china-from-all-u-s-plants-idUSKBN1YK1UL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tyson Foods</a></span><span> was approved to export American poultry to China from all 36 of its U.S. processing plants. Beijing lifted a nearly five-year ban on chicken imports last month.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-cineplex-m-a-cineworld-grp/cineworld-tops-north-american-box-office-with-cineplex-deal-idUSKBN1YK0GF?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Cineworld</a></span><span>, a British cinema operator, is buying Canadian counterpart Cineplex for $1.7 billion cash. It’ll become North America’s largest theater operator.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/video/tesla-touches-2-high-china-200705694.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tesla</a></span><span> stock jumped 6.5% after Credit Suisse said it has a “clear competitive advantage” in battery production.</span>
</li>

At the very least, we hope they do before voting on it this week to avoid another government shutdown.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nAVIATION\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/12/16/boeing-temporarily-shut-737-max-production?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nBoeing Takes Its Most Drastic Step Yet\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Boeing 737 Max planes parked\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM5ODI4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eStephen Brashear/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing said it will temporarily suspend production of the 737 Max aircraft in January in what the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/12/16/business/boeing-737-max.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT calls\u003c/a\u003e “one of the most consequential decisions in the manufacturer’s more than 100-year history.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe recent history: \u003c/strong\u003eThe 737 Max was involved in two fatal crashes that killed 346 people over the span of five months. The plane hasn’t seen the skies since March as regulators wait for a fix to an automated software system involved in both tragedies.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut production didn’t stop\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBoeing was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/boeing-to-suspend-737-max-production-in-january-11576532032?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill making\u003c/a\u003e around 40 737 Max planes each month in anticipation of getting the green light from authorities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eNow, it’s got about \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/0f4cbec6-2045-11ea-b8a1-584213ee7b2b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e400 Max planes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e racking up parking tickets at a Boeing facility near Seattle. That’s more than the 383 Max planes flying at the time the FAA grounded the model.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt didn’t really have a choice but to keep the 737 Max factory open. As of Nov. 30, Boeing had an order backlog of 4,545 Max models. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRipple effects \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company’s best selling plane is now the face of an industry-wide crisis. Because Boeing relies on a constellation of over 600 aerospace suppliers to feed it parts, if Boeing has to shut down its own assembly line, its suppliers likely have to do the same. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd when Boeing catches a cold, airlines get sick. Southwest and United won’t be flying the Max commercially until March at the earliest—American is waiting until early April. “We're not happy about our situation,” Southwest CEO Gary Kelly \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/24/airline-chiefs-frustrated-as-boeing-737-max-grounding-cost-nears-1-billion.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold CNBC\u003c/a\u003e in October.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe good news: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://boeing.mediaroom.com/2019-12-16-Boeing-Statement-Regarding-737-MAX-Production?sf226241718=1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estatement\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Boeing said it’s not expecting layoffs or furloughs right now.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the nation's top manufacturing exporter \u003cspan\u003eand one of its top private employers\u003c/span\u003e, Boeing’s factories are among the most closely watched in the world. Stopping production will likely hit U.S. GDP growth in Q1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" Chips\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"A computer powered by Intel \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf 30 is the new 20, Intel is making the case that 51 is the new founding year. In its latest effort to “turbo-charge” its artificial intelligence (AI) offerings, Intel \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/12/16/intel-buys-ai-chipmaker-habana-for-2-billion/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epaid\u003c/a\u003e $2 billion to acquire Israeli chip startup Habana Labs.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe purpose: \u003c/strong\u003eHabana’s chips will \u003ca href=\"https://www.engadget.com/2019/12/16/intel-ai-acquires-habana-labs/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoup up\u003c/a\u003e Intel's data centers to help algorithms translate numbers into trends.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut this is bigger than data storage\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIsn’t it always? Intel previously said it’s penciling in over \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90425160/inside-intels-billion-dollar-transformation-in-the-age-of-ai?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$3.5 billion\u003c/a\u003e in AI-related revenue this year, up 20% annually.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd it’s on the hunt for growth opportunities.\u003c/strong\u003e It can \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/intel-acquires-habana-labs-for-about-2-billion-11576508408?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eonly boost market share\u003c/a\u003e in its core business—powering personal computers and tablets—so much. So it’s looking to grab a little sunlight in the booming field of artificial intelligence.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2017, Intel paid $15.3 billion for vehicle camera maker Mobileye, which uses AI to train self-driving cars.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn 2016, it bought AI startup Nervana Systems for about $400 million.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe market for chips that power AI is expected to grow to $25 billion by 2024, per Intel. And almost half that revenue will likely come from selling chips used in giant data centers.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Want more AI news?\u003c/strong\u003e Subscribe to our newsletter Emerging Tech Brew \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/?utm_source=morning_brew\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_campaign=emtech\u0026email={email}\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehere\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F12%2F16%2Fintel-ups-ai-game-2-billion-acquisition-habana-labs\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTc2NTM4ODQ3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003ePixabay\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe only group of people more self-assured than Kumail Nanjiani are U.S. homebuilders, whose confidence shot up to a 20-year high for the month yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow do you measure “homebuilder confidence?” \u003c/strong\u003eUsing the National Association of Home Builders/Wells Fargo Housing Market Index. It \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/16/homebuilder-confidence-jumps-to-highest-level-in-20-years.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erose five points\u003c/a\u003e in December to 76, the highest level since June 1999. Any reading higher than 50 reflects optimism. \u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy life is good: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eunemployment at a \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nahb.org/news-and-publications/press-releases/2019/12/builder-confidence-ends-year-strong.aspx?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e50-year low\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, higher wages, and lower mortgage rates.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat could be better:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e if there were more available workers and land. A lack of inventory is driving home prices higher. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOverall, the index \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/u-s-homebuilder-sentiment-soars-to-20-year-high-on-sales-gains?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egained\u003c/a\u003e 20 points this year, its biggest increase since 2012. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThis housing data was just one of several positive readings for the economy yesterday. New York manufacturers said business conditions are (mostly) \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/201912163747/empire-state-manufacturing-surveys-measure-of-business-conditions-rises?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esolid\u003c/a\u003e, while \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-12-16/u-s-economy-ends-year-on-modest-note-ihs-markit-gauges-show?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esurveys\u003c/a\u003e of factories and the services sector didn’t raise any alarms.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTwo things in life are certain: death and holiday flight delays. If you thought we were going to say taxes...do we have some stats for you.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the left-leaning \u003ca href=\"https://itep.org/corporate-tax-avoidance-in-the-first-year-of-the-trump-tax-law/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eInstitute on Taxation and Economy Policy\u003c/a\u003e (ITEP), 379 of America’s biggest companies paid an average federal tax rate of about 11% last year, roughly half the official 21% rate established by President Trump’s 2017 tax cut.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e91 corporations in the Fortune 500 paid \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/12/16/these-91-fortune-500-companies-didnt-pay-federal-taxes-in-2018.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eno\u003c/em\u003e federal taxes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e last year despite earning a combined $101 billion. Their average federal tax rate was -5.9%, so...a tax refund.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow that happens: \u003c/strong\u003eInvesting in good accountants. And utilizing deductions, tax breaks, and other loopholes to lower their effective rates. Last year’s 11% rate is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/12/16/corporations-paid-percent-tax-rate-last-year-steep-drop-under-president-trumps-law/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elowest\u003c/a\u003e since ITEP started tracking in 1984.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eHad the 379 profitable members of the Fortune 500 paid a 21% rate on their profits, the government would have netted an additional $73.9 billion in revenue. Right now, D.C. is staring down a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/25/federal-deficit-increases-26percent-to-984-billion-for-fiscal-2019.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e$984 billion\u003c/a\u003e federal deficit.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
